Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel if you don t need to stay in the center”
Reviews.Author: avigilan
Reviews.Content: Efficient staff and service. Room was not large but functional and elegant. If you don t need to be in the center, a very good choice. Good breakfast. Newspaper selection could be wider.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at River Chateau Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beckph
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Feb 2012 when we visited Rome to see Italy v England in the Rugby 6 Nations. It is located away from the City Centre (which I think was a major plus point) and in a very nice residential area and was 15 minutes walk to the Stadio Olympico. The hotel restaurant wasn't open when we visited but there were numerous bars/restaurants within a few minutes walk from the hotel. The breakfast was very nice and there was a lot of choice. The room was lovely, well appointed and well sized and had a large balcony - although we didn't really use this as it was snowing when we stayed there. It is not far from the bus terminus (5 minutes walk after crossing the Ponte Milvio bridge) and it took about 15 minutes on the tram to get to the Flaminio terminus at Santa Maria del Popolo. Would definitely stay here again if and when we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Triple "A" service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: jaccuse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The River Chateau for six nights and can highly recommend this hotel for the exceptionally helpful and friendly staff, the high quality decor and comfort of the rooms and the excellent bar and restaurant. We found it difficult to find really good restaurants in Rome - perhaps we needed to venture further from the centre. But the restaurant in the hotel was the best of all our dining experiences. The food is authentic Roman cuisine prepared with fresh ingredients - the wine was excellent and the whole meal represented very good value for money. The Hotel is situated North of the centre of Rome in a nice area - plenty of restaurants and bars though not any that one would seriously recommend. A cab into the centre costs around 10 -12 euros or there are buses and trams. The out of town location is an advantage in that it is quieter and feels more personal - so many establishments in the centre seem bored with tourists! The River Chateau has comparable service to the the best hotels at which I have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing....”
Reviews.Author: AmericanTwoSome
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our trip to Rome. We stayed at the River Chateau Hotel for 4 nights and it exceeded all of our expectations. This hotel was beautiful! The breakfasts were amazing and very satisfying. All of the upgrades made that are included in this hotel made our stay so easy and enjoyable. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay there again. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and at a cheap price.”
Reviews.Author: thom3k
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say about the hotel, fantasticly comfy and well decorated rooms. Only downside is the distance from town and directions given by the hotels web page its self. Best way there from town; Line A to Flaminio then jump on either the number 2 tram or 2 bus ( N25 at night) until you reach the bridge at the top of the road. From there is a short 5 min walk across the bridge and to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, excellent rooms and service.”
Reviews.Author: Anon190832
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Unexpectedly, room had a balcony which was ideal for relaxing after a busy day in Rome. Good service from a small bar serving drinks and sandwiches. Breakfast excellent, well presented in a lovely breakfast room. Hotel fairly close to bus stop for transport to city centre, although quite a distance to walk. Tabac shop close by to purchase bus tickets from. (Don't forget to validate them on the bus!). A selection of bars and restaurants are close to the hotel. Some are very expensive. The whole area is very busy at night, particularly over the weekend. Restaurant attached to hotel but not open over the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Deborah1592
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the River Chateau with my husband and daughter after researching numerous hotels in Rome. We definitely made the right decision to stay here. Our triple standard room was beautiful and spacious by European standards. It was very hot while we were in Rome and our room was a cool, clean respite after a long day sightseeing. The breakfast that was included in the room price was a great way to start the day with cereals, pastries, meats and cheeses. My husband is an early riser and often went down before the breakfast hours to get a cup of coffee which the staff were kind enough to prepare for him. The hotel is away from the tourist areas but we enjoyed the neighborhood and either took the bus or a taxi (10-15 euros) into the city. There are lots of restaraunts and a few gelatto shops a short walk from the hotel. The staff at the hotel desk were friendly and helped us a great deal in making arrangements to see the various sights in Rome. We spoke with another couple from the US while we were on a tour and they were not having a similar experience at the hotel where they were staying. I would definitely stay here again if we ever come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great Value”
Reviews.Author: YVR2PVR
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay for 3 days but it turned into 5. We had adjoining rooms, one room with a King bed and one with two singles for our teenagers. The rooms were nice and clean and the satellite TV and internet were good. It is 10 minutes outside the city centre which we found perfect. There are good restaurants in the area and some shopping as well. We took a 15 Euro taxi to the city centre when we wanted to sight see. I had contacted about 20 hotels by email and this we chose this one based on the price and other reviews and we are very satisfied. Because of its proximity to the Olympic Stadium professional Soccer teams stay at this hotel. We went and saw a game and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, terrific staff!”
Reviews.Author: ricbre_98
Reviews.Content: My wife had business in Rome so I tagged along and we had a long weekend in Rome 30 Jan - 4 Feb 2009. The hotel is beautiful and our room was elegant. We had one of the rooms at the rear of the hotel that had a small balcony. Though the view was of neighboring buildings and rooftops, it was still very pictureesque. The hotel's restaurant was not open during our visit, as it was in the process of being taken under new management. However, this was not an inconvenience because there are numerous restaurants within a few minutes walk. My wife and I enjoyed eating locally and found that the staff at these local establishments were very tolerent of our limited Italian language skills. The front desk staff at the River Chateau were extremely helpful, from recommending local restaurants, to recommending local sites to visit, to giving directions, to calling for taxis, to making change. My wife and I had some very enjoyable conversations with a young Greek bartender on few evenings. They were all a pleasure to get to know. We had a Continental breakfast each morning in the hotel and the selection of breads, fruits, cereals, yogurt, etc. was more than adequate. And the coffee was excellent! Here, too, the staff was eager to be of assistance. As mentioned in other reviews, this hotel is quite a distance from the attractions in the center of Rome. But this is not a good reason to avoid staying at this hotel. My wife and I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harger
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our honeymoon. It was a great choice for our money. Room is excellently decorated and furbished, breakfast is huge and delicious and the staff was kind, too. The only backdraw is that the AC is controlled centrally, and you cannot turn it off, even if your toes are freezing in the middle of the night. Although, the hotel is not in the city center, if you have some sense of orientation you can find it easily, taking tram number 2 from Piazza Flaminio which is a subway station just beside Piazza del Popolo and walking for a few minutes through Ponte Milvio over the Tevere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: world_slider
Reviews.Content: Very nice quite hotel. Rooms are clean and classy. Pick one with the balcony facing rear and you will have a nice view. The hotel is 2 minutes from the river, after 8PM - crowds of teens, tourists, lot's of fun (they had a boxer match organized right on a street one night), lot's of cafes and etc., very safe place. In hotel all staff is very friendly. One thing - it looks like AC is not working at first (compared to US "wind blowers", but in the end it gets the work done. Strongly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great City”
Reviews.Author: MorpheusNL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the River Chateau for business and pleasure purposes for 5 nights in April 2008. The company that I work for has a good deal with the River Chateau and because my wife was flying over I decided to stay for 3 extra days (and nights) after 2 days of meetings at our office in Rome. For me it was my first stay in Rome and the River Chateau and it was great! In my opinion the River Chateau is a hotel that makes you feel welcome from the moment you set foot into the lobby. Sure, it is not directly in the center of Rome but still is located in a nice neighbour where the locals also go. Check-in was easy and I was located to room 314. The room was quite small but equipped with all necessary amenities. After a night sleep it turned out that my neighbour was quite loud and that the noise he made was reinforced by the door between his and my room. I requested a different room without a door connecting to the adjacent room and it was all taken care off without any problem. All my clothes, suitcase and items where moved by the hotel staff to room 308. It turned out that the rooms on the backside of the hotel have a balcony. Which is nice when the weather is good because in the afternoon there is still sun on the balcony. The breakfast and dinner at the hotel is also very good. The breakfast offers you enough choice to enjoy a decent breakfast and the cappucino is really worthwile. Having dinner at the hotel restaurant is also not a punishment. I have enjoyed dinner at the hotel restaurant on one evening with my colleagues. Everybody received their main course at the same time and the food itself and atmosphere was good. The only remark to this restaurant from my side would be; "why pictures of a New York skyline in your restaurant when you are located in a beautiful city as Rome?" If you want to have dinner elsewhere you can just walk down the street and choose one of the restaurants located there. I had dinner at restaurant "Voy" with my wife and enjoyed this restaurant as well. The River Chateau is located in the Northern part of Rome near the Olympic Stadium and on the otherside of the river which crosses through Rome. Getting to the center is relatively easy if you don't mind using public transport. We just walked down the street and across Ponte Milvio (don't forget to buy and hang a lock on the bridge). Once you are on the other side of the bridge cross the street and head for Piazza Mancini. There you take the tram to Piazza Del Popolo, tickets cost 1 euro for 75 minutes on the tram or bus and can be used for one metro trip. Once you reach Piazza del Popolo (12-15 minute ride) you can either take the metro on line B from station Flaminio (which is located on Piazza del Popolo) or go by foot because from the Piazza del Popolo you are within walking distance of the Spanish stairs, Via del Corse and Villa Borghese. In conclusion I would advise this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again! Sorry I couldn't post any photo's since I forgot to make any!

Reviews.Title: “What a great choice thanks to fellow reviewers”
Reviews.Author: Ozziepore
Reviews.Content: I am sitting in my room of the River Chateau as I write this, using the free internet service. I usually can't be bothered writing reports but I just had to in this case because I actually found the River Chateau here on tripadvisor. Finding a hotel in Rome that was clean, classy and a reasonable price was a difficult call and it took a great deal of research. Given some of the prices i saw and the stories I heard it was with some trepidation that we pulled up outside after a 20 hour flight from Australia. This hotel is certainly as good as the reviews make it out to be. It's clean, the staff are wonderful, the breakfast is great (plenty of choice, available from really early to 10.30 a.m.). The staff can't do enough to help you. Our room has a balcony, free internet, LCD TV, fabulous marble bathroom with mosaic, hand painted designs on ceiling, quality fittings throughout. The room has a turn down service every night with sweets left on the bed, lovely slippers, thick terry robe... what more can I say. 5 star service at a 3 star cost. The local area is also great; taxi driver told us the gelateria and cake shop down the road is famous throughout Rome - it was FABULOUS and there is also a small market for fresh fruit and veg and a bread shop/pizzzeria within a 5 minute walk. The Ponte Milvio bridge is just over the road from the market. Yes it's a way into town but I am so glad we didn't stay in town. Here it's quiet and pretty - well worth the 35 minutes on one bus and an MRT into town, or just the bus goes straight to the Vatican area. Normally I would keep a place like this secret, but I don't think we'll be back in Rome for a while so I thought I should do the right thing by the hotel and the tripadvisor community. Do yourself a favour and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, relaxing honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: SusieHornchurch
Reviews.Content: We went on a pre-wedding trip and stayed overnight to find that the hotel had misunderstood our requirements for the wedding/honeymoon stay. To rectify this, they agreed a much reduced rate on their sumptuous suite. All food at the hotel is fantastic, though evening meals were expensive. The staff are friendly and speak English very well and are patient while you try your Italian. Best of all for us was the tranquility as soon as you stepped inside the hotel. Rooms were spacious, clean and so peaceful. I would recommend, if you don't mind the taxi fares to get into town, that you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: Loppy1020
Reviews.Content: It is not close to Rome, but my wife and I enjoyed are leisurely walk to the city center. I believe it took about 30 minutes. There are buses to farther away places like the Vatican. The hotel and people of the town were very helpful in guiding us through the process. The Hotel was beautiful, quaint, and quiet. The rooms were spacious for Rome. Customer service here was good. The front desk spoke excellent english and provided us a map and useful information. Internet access in the room was a huge bonus. Breakfast was also very good. Eating on the veranda, weather permitting is a bonus. For the few people who spoke ill of this place, it seems that their expectations must be put into context. I have traveled extensively through Italy and stayed 1 or 2 hotels that were around 400 Euro a night hotels. This said, I can say this is one of my favorite hotels that where we stayed. You can often find deals to stay here at lower rates than listed. Hunt around at Hotels.com, venere.com and others. We managed to stay here for a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappoing stay”
Reviews.Author: Kilkerrannorth
Reviews.Content: The River Chateau Hotel in Rome The hotel was beautiful,our room was great ,however did not find the staff all that helpful,would not stay there again.We were leaving the hotel very early on Friday morning October 27th and asked the previous evening for some breakfast to be arranged for us,however there was nothing arranged .We got the breakfast bags eventually on the morning however we were made to feel as we were begging for what we had paid for. I asked if I could have some tea at 6.50 am and the answer was no as they did not start serving till 7.00am, well i think when you are paying 200 euro per night i think you should be entitled at the very least a cup of tea.We felt every thing was a chore for the staff on the catering side. Rome was beautiful however a very disappointing stay at the River Chateau I hope all hotels in Rome do not give this kind of sevice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicC
Reviews.Content: We ended up here courtesy of the Hotel Abitart, which did not honour our booking. That said, we consider ourselves lucky as the hotel was great. Nice, comfortable rooms and bathroom. Excellent breakfasts (make sure you get there before 10am to take full advantage) - the cakes/tarts are particularly good. The location is near the Olympic stadium and Flaminio - the actual road the hotel is on is pretty trendy and there are some good bars and cafes here. Easy to get into town: the bus at the junction of the road takes you to Mancini and from there it's a tram to Popolo.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little place outside of the hustle and bustle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Noalita
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! I know it is out of the way but the bus runs every 15 minutes to the center of town. It looks like a 5 star hotel and is run like one but for a fraction of the price. I asked the concierge for a restaurant recommendation and she got us into the most delicious place. She also helped us with our early departure and they even packed us scrumptious breakfasts to go! The room was so pretty with marble bathrooms, and elegant decor, not to mention the free internet service in room and multitude of channels to choose from. I booked a July stay in February and the cost of one night was 80 euros!! Which is unheard of in high season in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blue1970
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for a 10th anniversary treat to ourselves. The hotel stands up to its reputation, however as other guests have noted it is difficult to find if you are not used to Rome's transport system. It is situated on via Flaminia which is an extremely long road so you cant go by the road name alone. Get the Metro line A to Ottaviano, then go to the bus stop and board the 32. (Remember to buy your bus ticket from either a tobacconist or the train station ticket machine "ATAC" before you get on the bus). After about 10/15 minutes the bus leaves the main road and circulates a large grey official looking building right next to the Stadio Olympico, then it will rejoin the same main road. (Tor di Quinto) When it does this, press the stop button and get off at the next stop. You will then need to cross the road and find you way up to the hotel. (5 minutes walk at most). Alternatively print the map off and get a taxi from the city centre, should be about 10-15 Euro, but ask the taxi driver before you get in. He will then know you are aware how much it should be. The hotel itself is beautiful inside, and the buffet breakfasts were typically European, (ie fresh fruit, croissants, cold meats & cheese & cake!). The staff were attentive and helpful and spoke excellent English. Other than the hassle of finding it, I cant think of another gripe. (Although I was charged 16 Euro's for 2 Gin & Tonic's which I think was a mistake but I couldn't challenge it as I was on the taxi home when I noticed)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent by very far from the center”
Reviews.Author: life43
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent four days in October in this beautiful hotel. We had a pretty standard room with twin super confortable separated beds (not just put togheter). The room was very cozy and had a balcony with a very nice view. We had free Internet in the room through the LCD TV. Even the ceiling was decorated. It´s very silent at night, despite the music and noise in the hotel´s restaurant. The bathroom was great, with a mosaic decoration and everything first class there. Check in and check out were very quick and the staff very friendly. We remember Alejandro and Rogelio (we had a problem with the keyboard and he got another one for us in a second). The hall has somewhat of mixed styles in decoration but that´s irrelevant. The buffet breakfast, included in the price, was very good, and the staff there very nice and efficient. Just the bread wasn´t very good. The only (but important) problem was the location. The neighborhood is fine but the hotel is far from every touristic places in Rome. Since we left the hotel each morning, got the bus and arrived to the center loosed almost one hour. On Sunday didn´t pass nor buses nor taxis and only after almost 2 hours we could arrive to Piazza Navona. If you plan a trip to Roma, try to avoid Sundays! Everynight we took a taxi to return, always remarking that the hotel is near Ponte Milvio. Once we forgot to tell it to the taxi driver and he got lost. If you want a good pizzeria, go to La Scalinata, Via Sant´Andrea delle Fratte, 32, near the Fontana di Trevi. The place is very nicely decorated, with high quality cuisine. Alessandro and the other waiter are great (the best in Italy)! By the way, it´s closed on Sundays! If I return to Rome and decide to rent a car, it´s for sure I´ll go to River Chateau again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but difficult to find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, awesome room and bath and friendly english speaking staff. Breakfast had a good variety and was served in a pleasant setting. The only draw back was if using public transportation, it is difficult to find and there is limited bus service. It took 45 minutes to reach the hotel from any of the main tourist sights. Not for first time visitors. On the plus side, it is located near the site of the Olympic facility and in a charming, safe, trendy neighborhood. The terrace was a nice addition, unfortunately it rained most of the time we were visiting. (Free umbrellas though!) Some helpful directions: If reaching hotel by car, use mapping software to get you to Corsa Francia, then call hotel from your cell phone and have them talk you the rest of the way. By public transportation, take Metro to Ottaviano (St. Peter's), then take 32 bus (starts near Metro stop). When bus goes through Olympic Park it will come to a "T" (red building on right at corner) then make a left turn at the river. As soon as it turns, hit the 'Stop' button and get off at the next stop. You will be in front on a bridge passing over the street and across from some huts/stands that sell fruit/veggies, kitchen items, etc during the day. You will see a sign for a Honda dealership in front of what looks like an apartment building. Go to the far right of this building and go up this street (street was being worked on - name not available) but you will see a couple of auto-electrical shops 100 feet or so up the block. Make a right at the next corner and the hotel will be 300 feet to the right.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Joylee
Reviews.Content: Just got back a visit of Rome, stayed 10 nights at the River Chateau Hotel, absolutely fabulous and highly recommend! The staff there are very accomodating and professional! Thank you Roberto for all your assistance. The daily breakfast has a very good selection of meats, cheeses, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruits, eggs and assorted breads/pastires. The staff works at accomodating your every request. Rooms are well appointed and luxurious. The hotel is located away from the major sites of interest, we found this to be a delight as this is a bustling city. Despite having a car, we simply took taxis that ran abut 8 - 12 Euros one way, or walked (though it is a quite a hike to Spanish Steps etc. there is so much to see along the way). I do not recommend driving into the city. As another poster noted, the hotel is new, coupled with the fact that "Via Flaminia" has an old and new portion it can be difficult to find - even for taxi drivers. If you tell the driver it is near the Milvio Bridge (walking bridge) and the Olympic stadium they will usually find it, or they simplly call the hotel. There are many fine restaurants in the area, all at reasonable prices for Italy/Europe. Suggest "Cafe Cassa Mortaro" reservations highly suggested, "Palotta" and the restaurant across from the hotel to the left. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “coooooool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, we stayed there for four nights in late march 2005 (sorry for writing this so late) no problems, helpful staff , very clean, excellent reception

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: PowerPlant53
Reviews.Content: Went for my husbands birthday. The hotel was fabulous, we stayed in the double room for for 3 nights at 125 euros per night. Bargain. Everywhere was marble. The breakfast had a good choice available and included in the price. The staff were very friendly, showed us how to get around. You can travel in Rome for 75 minutes for 1 euro! The hotel booked a car to collect us from the airport and to take us back again for 110 euros. Brilliant. The only downsize was that it is out of the city centre, but it was in a lovely area and very quiet - no sleep was lost! At the bottom of the road there are a few restaurants and this is where the Italians eat - always a good recommendation! We found a briliant and very cheap restaurant (can't remember it's name!) It was very busy, but they always found us a table. They could barely speak English, but we got by. 20 euros for a 2 course meal, cappachinos and a litre of wine for 2 people! We will definteley be going back to the hotel and the restaurant - can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The River Chateau Hotel was a wonderful place to stay in Rome. We stayed in a room for 98 Euro a night. The room itself was beautiful. We had a computer/television as well. Even the bathroom was beautiful, with a mosaic above the bathtub. Everything was spotless. The people working at the desk were always helpful and accomodating. The breakfast was the best we had in any of our hotels, with a large variety of foods. The only concern we had with the hotel was the location. The hotel is located in a nice area of Rome. However, it is a bit of a distance from the main sights of Rome. There is a bus which is about a block away from the hotel which takes you into the heart of Rome. However, you will need to take a Taxi or bus back to the hotel, it is not someplace you can walk to from the main sights (Vatican city, Spanish Steps, Colleseum, etc). I would also recommend printing a map of where the hotel is and bring the phone number when you first arrive in Rome. The hotel is off many of the Rome maps we had. We took taxies two times to the hotel, and neither taxi driver knew where it was. One called the hotel on his cell phone, the other driver used the map I had printed off the internet from the hotel website. We would recommend it, just know that it is not in the heart of the sites. However, for the price we paid and the service we got, we felt it was worth it.

HotelInfo.Name: River Chateau Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Flaminia 520, 00191 Rome, Italy
